str2: Hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor. From akouo; hearing.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and erchomai; to go off, aside or behind, literally or figuratively.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Syria, a great Roman imperial province, united with Cilicia. Probably of Hebrew origin; Syria, a region of Asia.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Badly, evilly, wrongly. From kakos; badly.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Various, of different colors, diverse, various. Of uncertain derivation; motley, i.e. Various in character.
A disease, malady, sickness. Of uncertain affinity; a malady.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and echo; to hold together, i.e. To compress or arrest; figuratively, to compel, perplex, afflict, preoccupy.
Torture, torment, examination by torture. Perhaps remotely from the same as basis; a touch-stone, i.e. torture.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be possessed, be under the power of an evil-spirit or demon. Middle voice from daimon; to be exercised by a d?Mon.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To be a lunatic, be moonstruck, epileptic.
And, even, also, namely.
Afflicted with paralysis. From a derivative of paraluo; as if dissolved, i.e. 'paralytic'.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From the same as therapon; to wait upon menially, i.e. to adore, or to relieve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
